intro: Hymenandra iteophylla, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette of foliage. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, are pollinated primarily by insects. Hymenandra iteophylla is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
